70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (09:28): http://sandbox.thewikies.com/html5-pangram/ and http://sandbox.thewikies.com/html5-pangram/short.html
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (09:28): always has a bad hair morning; unless it's extremely short
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (09:30): 70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132: you should put some ads on that page
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (09:31): So it can be even uglier?
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (09:31): I'm not done, the short will be how I write an html5 normalize stylesheet
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (09:31): no, to match expectations; i think you've posted the link about 20 times now :P
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (09:32): It first follows the whatwg's rendering recommendation, followed then by popular vendor styling.
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (09:32): 70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132, most people in this channel read the backlog
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (09:32): Note taken.
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (09:32): :)
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (09:33): I didn't even know there was a backlog to be read.  I thought the best strategy was to always stir up trouble.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:33): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0: who implements the three-argument postMessage on Window?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:34): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0: if nobody does, or if everyone is willing to change their implementations, i don't mind changing it
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (09:34): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: opera does (not shipped yet, but is implemented), not sure about the others

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:34): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0: the reason postMessage()'s ports argument was added in the middle was to keep it closer to the message argument, where it makes more sense
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:34): i.e. having "message, message, target" rather than "message, target, message"
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (09:35): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: i think the common reaction to having it in the middle is "WTF?"
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:35): if everyone is willing to change their implementations, i don't mind changing it
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:35): no need to convince me on logical grounds :-)
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (09:36): can only speak for opera
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:41): well if you can find out who else implements it i can go ask them
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (09:42): pretty sure WebKit must have it
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (09:42): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: it seems chrome implements it
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:43): k, i'll ask them about it tomorrow
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (09:43): but not firefox
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:44): ooh, new freeman's mind
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:44): bbiab!
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:51): ok where was i
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (09:51): you were about to fix all my bugs
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:56): oh yes

cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (10:19): it's weird that people's reaction to "feature x and y seem like they should do what i want, but are buggy in browsers A and B" is "how about introducing feature z?" instead of "how about fixing x and y in A and B?"
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:22): yeah
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:22): i see that all the time also
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:28): anyone else having difficulty using the bug filing thing in the spec?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:35): ok bed time
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:35): nn

73cc301f328d92a18944f8e1a0d91e72 (10:48): is opera's treatment of page-break-* in @media projection okay in standards?
0da07476c4bd14079ce4032a6f280e17 (10:49): 73cc301f328d92a18944f8e1a0d91e72: to answer that question, you would have to first explain what it is you think Opera does with it

73cc301f328d92a18944f8e1a0d91e72 (10:49): it split advancement by pagedown by the pages
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (10:49): 73cc301f328d92a18944f8e1a0d91e72, projection is paged-based media
73cc301f328d92a18944f8e1a0d91e72 (10:50): is writing a CSS+fragment slideshow
